00033 /** 
00034  * Convert a Scale enumeration to a text description. 
00035  * @param s - Enumerated value.
00036  * @return - String version of enumeration value.
00037  */
00038 std::string QuantMethod::scaleToTxt(enum QuantMethod::Scale s) {
00039   switch (s) {
00040   case Linear : 
00041     return "linear";
00042   case Log2 :
00043     return "log2";
00044   case Pvalue :
00045     return "p-value";
00046   case NegLog10 :
00047     return "neg-log10";
00048   default:
00049     Err::errAbort("QuantMethod::scaleToTxt() - Unknown type: '" + ToStr(s) + "'");
00050   }
00051   return ""; // avoid compiler warnings
00052 }
00053 
00054 
00055 /** 
00056  * Convert a QuantType enumeration to a human readable string representation.
00057  * @param q - QuantType to convert.
00058  * @return - Text version of QuantType enumeration.
00059  */
00060 std::string QuantMethod::quantTypeToTxt(enum QuantMethod::QuantType q) {
00061   switch (q) {
00062   case Summarize : 
00063     return "signal";
00064   case Detection :
00065     return "detection";
00066   case GenoCall :
00067     return "genotype";
00068   default :
00069     Err::errAbort("QuantMethod::quantTypeToTxt() - Unknown type: '" + ToStr(q) +"'");
00070   }
00071   return ""; // avoid compiler warnings
00072 }

00080 /** 
00081  * @brief Set up the quantification method given all the data about the probe
00082  * set, chip layout and data. Avoids issues of transformations and
00083  * adjustments for a more streamlined approach.
00084  * 
00085  * @param psGroup - Probes to be used for final estimate.
00086  * @param iMart - Raw data from chips.
00087  * @return True if setup sucessful, false otherwise.
00088  */
00089 bool QuantMethod::setUp(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart) {
00090   std::vector<ChipStream *> iTrans;
00091   PmOnlyAdjust pmAdjust;
00092   return setUp(psGroup, iMart, iTrans, pmAdjust);
00093 }
00094 
00095 /** 
00096  * @brief Transform raw data for probe index on chip and chip index using the
00097  * chip stream intensity transformers.
00098  * 
00099  * @param probeIx - Probe index on chip.
00100  * @param chipIx - Chip index in experiment.
00101  * @param iMart - Raw data. 
00102  * @param iTrans - Transformations to be applied to data.
00103  * 
00104  * @return 
00105  */
00106 float QuantMethod::transformPrimaryData(probeid_t probeIx, 
00107                                         chipid_t chipIx, 
00108                                         const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00109                                         std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans,
00110                                         unsigned int channelIx) {
00111   float intensity;
00112   if (iTrans.empty()) {
00113     intensity = iMart.getProbeIntensity(probeIx, chipIx, channelIx);
00114   }
00115   else {
00116     intensity = iTrans[iTrans.size() - 1]->getTransformedIntensity(probeIx, chipIx, channelIx);
00117   }
00118   return intensity;
00119 }
00120 
00121 /** 
00122  * @brief Returns PM minus attenuated mismatch value so such that the return value is 
00123  * greater than or equal to zero. In short, we return (x+sqrt(x^2+H))/2 where 
00124  * H = 4*pM*MM*L and X = PM-MM. This is in effect generalized log without the log
00125  * transformation.
00126  * 
00127  * @param pmI - perfect match intensity
00128  * @param mmI - mismatch intensity
00129  * @param l - optional tunable parameter, default is 0.005 must be between 0 and 1 inclusive
00130  * @param h - optional parameter, allows one to override computation of H from
00131  * data. If less than zero computed from data as 4*PM*MM*l
00132  * 
00133  * @return 
00134  */
00135 float QuantMethod::attenuateIntensity(float pmI, float mmI, float l, float h) {
00136   h = h < 0 ? 4*pmI*mmI*l : h; // if h is less than zero, calculate default value: H = 4*PM*MM*L
00137   // X = PM-MM
00138   // glog(X,H) = log( (X+sqrt(X^2+H))/2)
00139   // we return the non log value here
00140   return ( (pmI-mmI)+sqrt(((pmI-mmI)*(pmI-mmI)) + h) )/2;
00141 
00142 }
00143 
00144 /** 
00145  * What scale are the target effects on? Are they linear (like
00146  * plier) or log2 (like rma)
00147  * @return - What scale are the results provided in?
00148  */
00149 enum QuantMethod::Scale QuantMethod::getScale() {
00150   return Linear;
00151 }
00152 
00153 /** 
00154  * What type of quantification method is this? Summarization like
00155  * plier detection like dabg.
00156  * @return - Type of quantification method.
00157  */
00158 enum QuantMethod::QuantType QuantMethod::getQuantType() {
00159   return Summarize;
00160 }

00171 bool QuantMethod::prepare(const IntensityMart &iMart) {
